caseStudy.content:
Year: 2025

What I did: Branding, Web Design, Social Media

Completed

After CRFT, I wanted more. Branding a conceptual music venue was fun and all, but it got me thinking… How would this idea of one brand with multiple faces look like in a real (not so real) nonprofit organization? Could they brand themselves in a way that both tackles a serious topic while being able speak to a younger audience that can often feel “unseen” by these groups? That’s the challenge I took on with Hunger Action Coalition (probably should have been “THE” Hunger Action Coalition...)

caseBlocks.textBlock:
Gotta Start Somewhere

Normally, I'd do a whole lotta market / user / inner research, but in this case I gave myself 3 days to build out this (conceptual) organization from the ground up. So I took an unsual first step here by picking out an initial core pallette and building out a logo suite. Followed by some (probably way too early) sketches of a landing page.

From Neutral to Bold

With a palette in place, typeface locked in (PP Neue Montreal), and a logo, it was time to explore the bold face. What better way then some social media posts? This particular series was made to clearly showcase how the “faces” could live in harmony. The first three are a bit more serious and tame, while the following three introduce bold colors and imagery while still maintaining core brand elements, creating ultimate cohesion.

Brand in Action

After creating social media posts to prove my point about the two-faced brand, I decided to keep going. This organization would understand that this brand direction could work if it was the last thing I do. So I threw together some more professional settings they could show up.

Website

With the brand in place and fully showcased it made sense to put together a landing page for the main site and for the volunteering page as the final sprint deliverables. This was the penultimate showcase of the brand with many faces. The goal was to create a site that follows the core look, and use the volunteer page to explore that more bold vibrant look.

Reflection

I’ll admit, this one was a little messy. I moved through research and design decisions quickly, but even at that pace, I created a two voiced system that I’d feel confident showing a client as a starting point for the next phase. The key takeaway here is proving that a nonprofit doesn't have to be one note, it can sing a whole song.
